website_summaries.verdict: An excellent plant cover that protects against a variety of hazards without costing a lot of money.
pros: Covers a large area yet comes at an affordable price
Protects plants from frost, UV damage, and insects
Promotes germination as it maintains moisture and warmth
cons: Material is somewhat thin and may not protect against severe weather or frost

customer_reviews.title: Great fabric, easy to cut, large amount
customer_reviews.text: Generous amount of material. Easy to cut to whatever size you need. I haven't had a below 30 night since purchasing but my seedlings have done very well 35 and above. The sprinklers run at night and water still comes thru, which is good, less watering during the day. I made hoops so the fabric doesn't smash the plants when it gets really wet. I secure the cover with long stapled. Hail season is almost upon us, so i'm interested to see how it holds up. I'll do a follow up review then.
customer_reviews.author: Miranda Rae Idol

customer_reviews.title: NIGHTTIME USE ONLY!
customer_reviews.text: Not good for daytime use. This cloth is perfect for protecting my garden from the chilly nights, but I highly recommend that you remove it early in the morning as this cloth does not allow enough sunlight to penetrate and your plants may die, as some of mine did.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Evans

customer_reviews.title: We've used them 4 times, over 2 years...still in great shape!
customer_reviews.text: We live in South Louisiana, and our freezes are infrequent. However, 2 or 3 times a winter we need to cover my favorite planters. After 2 years, these plant covers have done the job and are still in perfect shape. Be sure to wrap them snuggly at the bottom of your large pot (we use bricks) and don't forget to remove the coverings when the temps warm up. Otherwise, your beautiful plants will have a nasty burn in the spots that touch the covering and catch the most heat. Good luck. We are pleased with them. I know these work well with gardens, but we don't have one.
customer_reviews.author: JoAnn

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I started using this cover to protect my tomatoes since October; Dcember is almost ending and my plants are perfect and still producing tomatoes after a few freezing cold nights and days. Light, sun, air, everything goes through it except cold. I have no clue how that is possible but I’m impressed of how well this works.
customer_reviews.author: M.R.

customer_reviews.title: Thin and cheap
customer_reviews.text: I have an old plant cover that I have used for 14 years. I bought this as a replacement and it tore the first time I used it. It is thin and cheap, I swear it is the same fabric used for interfacing. Water beads up on top of it...does not let rainwater through. I am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: good value, quite a bit of fabric. Does absorb water, so when it rained the fabric came down on the plants and created a soaking issue, but I was not using it on a frame, just laid over the plants, so that doesn't seem unreasonable. Did dry really well and re-used easily.
customer_reviews.author: lizziejean

customer_reviews.title: Would be great to help protect garden from insects.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item late winter so I don't know how good it can prevent froze bite. Picture is a comparison between name brand sold at Home Depot (green color). I think the fabric is thinner than the one sold at Home Depot (or maybe the color). With being a summer time, I think this item would be great to help prevent insect to eat your produce in the garden because the light can go through the plants. I will have more update once I put the fabric together to the size of container I have. Update* i cut it up and use it as insects protector
customer_reviews.author: Jang

customer_reviews.title: Good Product Good Price.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to cover my late lettuce plants. They had come up and we're doing well till the deer ate them down almost to the bud. I built a simple frame to hole it up off the plants about a foot tall and it has worked very well. The lettuce is growing very nice. I may a nice salad within a few weeks. I just put dirt around d the edges and even with the heavy rains we have had in Southern Maryland this fall it has stayed down nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffery T. Loveless

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the moths out.
customer_reviews.text: I'm covering up my zucchini plants to keep the moths out this year. They actually seem to be flourishing. I'm planning on reusing it next year because it is so durable. The water and the light flow right through to the plants and the weight of it doesn't affect the plants at all. I did not prop it up. I just draped it over the plants, left slack for them to grow, and secured the edges with stakes.
customer_reviews.author: cory b

customer_reviews.title: Perfect if you like flimsy, unwieldy, and wasting your money
customer_reviews.text: Complete waste of money. We didn’t need last year as it didn’t get cold enough. But tried to use for first time this winter. Flimsy, tears easier than tissue paper, doesn’t cover the area advertised. Threw one of the three away we ordered as it tore up so many places it was worthless to use. The second one we used, but have no intention of using again once this winter is over. The third bag is opened and will forever stay that way. Your best use of money will be to buy or use old bed sheets. They would hold up far better and be much less expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Scott

customer_reviews.title: Garden RX
customer_reviews.text: These are the best things to put over newly planted seed that need protection. We have an issue of little mice finding out garden and digging the newly planted seeds in one night. Putting this over the rows keeps the little buggers from digging. Also keep the plants protected from other elements as well.
customer_reviews.author: JP at Hood Canal

customer_reviews.title: Frost protection
customer_reviews.text: Got this to protect my tomato plants from the first frosts, been holding up perfectly in the low 30s for a week! Moving the plants indoors this weekend, this did it's job and I couldn't be happier with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ali-Docious

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: Can pull on it for a snug fit without tearing. Held mine down with the large garden Staples. So far it's working out great and it has been pretty windy. Already can tell my broccicas and spinach are happier.
customer_reviews.author: RAP

customer_reviews.title: Shockingly effective
customer_reviews.text: I was very skeptical of this product and unsure that such a thin material could truly protect plants. I can’t speak to temps well below freezing but I have used this in 30 degree weather (with plants on a covered patio) and all of my finicky plants survived. Very pleased
customer_reviews.author: ema

customer_reviews.title: Saved my flowers through the winter.
customer_reviews.text: I live in Texas. I used this plant cover over my geraniums and for the first time ever I have geraniums alive in the winter after several day of freezing weather as bad as 28 degrees nights. I don't know if this would be effective in colder parts of the country but here in Texas it works really well.
customer_reviews.author: Charles deGaulle

customer_reviews.title: Hard to use.  Update - This company has the best customer service I have ever seen.
customer_reviews.text: This is hard to use unless you’re wrapping a plant. I would like to update this review. The company contacted me about my disappointment and offered a refund. I told them I actually use the product and it works well now that I’ve learned to wrap the plant. They contacted me again to offer a $5 refund and I said no. What great customer service from this company. I applaud you!
customer_reviews.author: Unknown

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I used this to loosely place over hoops on a raised vegetable bed to keep the deer & chipmunks out. Used in June I pinned the edges into soil with U staple pins. It was easy to use and soft & light to work with & looked better than alternatives Ive had. Pleased it would keep things off but let light & rain through but after 2 weeks it has lost its strength & come apart like tissue paper leaving big hole in top. Too expensive to use If i have to replace every 2 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Smudge

customer_reviews.title: Cover  disintegrated and tore after just 2 months installed over hoops. Seller refunded me promptly.
customer_reviews.text: I was initially very pleased with the row cover. I bought it to protect my chard from leaf miner and it served me well. It was lightweight which allowed the sunlight through but not the bugs. Unfortunately, though installed as directed and in full sun only part of the day, I noticed it tearing after just 2 months. It was so weakened that in some places it would tear when just touched. Fortunately I had enough leftover unused that I will be able to continue covering my plants for the rest of the growing season. On the plus side, when I contacted the seller about my problem, they quickly refunded my money.
customer_reviews.author: BoiseBob

customer_reviews.title: Good value - we'll see about durability
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this to protect our early garden plantings and it is doing that. We created a frame from 1/2 inch PVC pipe and draped this material over it, weighting the ends to prevent wind taking it away. We are hoping to get more than one season from this, but we'll see about that. It is dense enough that most rain pools or runs off, not getting through to the plants. That may be true of any of these kinds of materials. It is fairly thin material.
customer_reviews.author: WileEC

customer_reviews.title: Does not let moisture through.
customer_reviews.text: I got two packages. My first use was to cover and warm my soil to get a jump on summer vegetables and protection from bugs. We aren’t freezing here anymore. This product is lightweight and durable, but it’s not letting moisture through to water as advertised. I may try and use the product for frost protection in the fall as I have a frame in another part of my garden that I can put it over then access the plants underneath to water.
customer_reviews.author: Lori P

customer_reviews.title: Durable and recommended
customer_reviews.text: Happy that we got the plant cover. We prematurely planted tomatoes and other veggies so we were worried about the overnight freezes but so far so good. We’ve kept on even during the day because of the temperature and remove it when the weather is better. Plants are thriving under the cover. Do Have to say that we have to figure out how to hold it up since it does not come with any hoops brother type of pole so used a garden fence and broke it up in three to place support to hold the cover at each end and middle. Only used half of cover so have extra for next time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Thick high quality
customer_reviews.text: Very nice material. Is protecting my outside aloe vera garden from frost and cold. I get 25 degree F nights here.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Multi-use but came with holes
customer_reviews.text: We bought this in the summer to keep our lettuce shaded to prevent bolting. It worked well for this application and we plan on reusing in fall and spring as a frost cover. My only compliant is that upon arrival it already had a few holes 4-5 inches long in it that looked like it might have been from a box cutter. We still used it and it worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: KY Gardener

customer_reviews.title: Use this for patio plants
customer_reviews.text: I got this to cover my patio plants during the winter. I live in Texas where the winters are mild but we experience a few freezing nights. Because I ordered the 8x24 size, I was able to fold the cover to make a double layer over the plants. In spite of that, a few of the plants did not survive the cold temps. The cover is reusable, so I plan to use it again next year and try folding it to make a triple layer.
customer_reviews.author: C. Holcomb

customer_reviews.title: deteriorated very quickly, but seller refunded full purchase price
customer_reviews.text: This row cover did the job on our spring broccoli but when I tried to re use it in August for a fall crop it fell apart like tissue paper. I literally could not lift it without tearing it. Do not buy, you will be wasting your money. UPDATE: seller refunded full purchase price
customer_reviews.author: Larrypac

customer_reviews.title: Protection for plants
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a set of plant blankets & jackets right before freezing temps hit. Delivery was fast. Since I’ve only had them 2 days I can’t give my full stamp of approval. I do like what I’ve seen so far. The blankets are long so they cover groups of shrubs easily. As for durability, I haven’t had them long enough to judge how long they will hold up to wind & weather.
customer_reviews.author: Rachelle Alexander McWhorter

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: A little disappointed, used for a week before holes appeared. I do have to admit we have very high winds which could have been a factor. But we did experience frost and my lettuce still survived. I’m hoping to get another season out of them even with the holes
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product — works like a charm.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Does exactly what it claims: protects gardens, containers, and raised beds from critters and weather, but still allows rain and sunlight to get through, plus it’s washable and reusable. Great product — it’s staying on my go-to garden list.
customer_reviews.author: Katie1776

customer_reviews.title: Keeps plants warm
customer_reviews.text: Used this to make bags to cover my plants from frost in the spring and they survived a snowstorm. I was very impressed and I will try this product as a cover for my winter garden.
customer_reviews.author: K. Lee

customer_reviews.title: After Sales Service is wonderful.
customer_reviews.text: Although the product did not last as long as I had hoped for in the sun and the rain, the after sales service was wonderful. I got a full refund and an offer to have a different, lighter cover sent to me. I had installed the cover over hoops, hoping to have it cover my cabbage the entire summer, but it is more appropriate for a reusable temporary cover. The material seems very strong, but the sun does deteriorate it. It is described as a reusable plant cover, which is exactly what it is.
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy Regehr

customer_reviews.title: Was useful, but did not last 1 year
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this product initially. It helped to over winter my fall crops like lettuce, spinach, kale, and broccoli. Unfortunately, was not as durable as I would have liked. Now it's pretty much in pieces and obviously did not withstand the weather. Can not use a single piece to cover any of my raised garden beds or small plants. Will need to find and purchase something else for the fall and winter season. Very hesitant about purchasing any other plant covers.
customer_reviews.author: Tasha

customer_reviews.title: Great frost and bug barrier.
customer_reviews.text: It keeps my garden protected from insects and for that, it gets 4 stars. However it does not allow water through the fabric, I have purchased AG Fabric from other sources in the past that allowed rain and garden hose water to penetrate so I am disappointed for that reason. As a frost barrier, it will be great so I will save the remainder for this winter.
customer_reviews.author: HappyLemonHead

customer_reviews.title: Shreds up in 6-8weeks
customer_reviews.text: ZERO stars if I could. I wanted reusable, as it said. But after 2 months it is all shredded up. No animal attacked it either. Just a totally terrible product. Don't bother.
customer_reviews.author: BCM

customer_reviews.title: Very good product.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for covering one of my garden boxes. Let's in some light and protects them from direct intense sunlight. Still have a lot of fabric left for other garden boxes.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Malave

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Product
customer_reviews.text: I love this even though it’s very light it worked beautifully on my Bush I covered it up and it froze outside for 2 or three nights no spots on my Bush will order some more but I do live in Houston
customer_reviews.author: kim s herod

customer_reviews.title: completely falls apart after one season
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this a year ago and went to use it today. It is now of the texture of a lantern mantle after burning. It literally disintegrates in my hands. The product description is deceptive. It would have been a great buy if it lasted, but it doesn't. I would give this zero stars but that isn't available.
customer_reviews.author: PAUL MECHANIC

customer_reviews.title: Not durable in sunlight
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this in Feb 2018. I cut it in half and used half to protect plants from frost, worked fine. Later used it again as sun protection for lettuce, etc., and it started falling apart after a month or two. Replaced the first half with the second and again, after a short time fell apart. So not even a full season of use.
customer_reviews.author: johnsdo

customer_reviews.title: Plant cover
customer_reviews.text: Used over our garden area to protect our plants did an Awesome job. We used clothes pins to attach to wire in garden( sold separately)
customer_reviews.author: Margot Schellenger

customer_reviews.title: Protecting my plants
customer_reviews.text: I have used this plant cover to protect my plants so I don’t know how good it is until after the cold weather has passed. It was easy too use and covered everything I needed done. Thank You
customer_reviews.author: HELEN S.

customer_reviews.title: Thesse appear to be light enough that I won't be using a frame
customer_reviews.text: I have not had to use yet but should have bought 2 for $12.99. I just ordered the second one for $13.99. I expect this product to help save some of my bonsai plants and some of out semi-topicals we are growing in GA.
customer_reviews.author: Terry M

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product and great company
customer_reviews.text: I love that I could find it in 8-ft width, makes it a snap to set up protective tunnels for my raised garden beds. And was so surprised and pleased that the order arrived after just one day! Quality products and excellent service, that's a company that will get continued orders! Well done!
customer_reviews.author: C. C. Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: Easy way to protect your plants
customer_reviews.text: I needed a way to protect some potted plants on cold nights and this works great. Used during a snow storm that left 20 inches of snow. Removed the cover after 4 days and plants were doing great. Great product and price can't be beat
customer_reviews.author: jo

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: These worked really well for my succulents! Although, trying to deal with cutting it into smaller pieces was terribly difficult.
customer_reviews.author: Peperomiapink9

customer_reviews.title: Its not durable material.!
customer_reviews.text: Firstly, When i touch I loved its material but when i use it, i saw its not durable material. It was torn while im using it.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Plant covers
customer_reviews.text: Nice size, exactly what I wanted. Live in phoenix but have had freezing temps so needed these quickly. So glad I got them fast. Hope plants will be ok when it gets warmer. Will order again. Good price, too.
customer_reviews.author: M. Earnest

customer_reviews.title: Great protection for your plants!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used them yet. It is still summer. I opened the package. The material is of good quality and the size will cover my plants. I think they will be great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: uhmmm
customer_reviews.text: Last winter, my plants were in my balcony (Maryland) under this cover, and all died.
customer_reviews.author: Laura A

customer_reviews.title: Very long
customer_reviews.text: I like the size of these coverings. They are lightweight and had to be held down by rocks but they're perfect for those few times when it gets close to freezing overnight
customer_reviews.author: Cat A

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: my husband and I just wrapped our 2 Yucca plants with our purchase. Wonderful, easy to use, waterproof. Would highly recommend! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: LM

customer_reviews.title: Perfect plumeria blanket
customer_reviews.text: I needed something to keep the plumerias from freezing over, normal gauge protection covers are just too heavy for the weak branches of the trees so I sought a lighter but just as efficient cover without having to build a support frame. This is the perfect cover the size was perfect and it can but cut very easily to adjust adjust the length but not thin enough to rip if touched.
customer_reviews.author: Beachbum22Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: DeeZines
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size, great price, very durable and allows light through and frost out. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Deezigns

customer_reviews.title: Great for potted plants
customer_reviews.text: These kept my front porch plants safe and happy all winter.
customer_reviews.author: MiMi

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Very lightweight Easy to use. I would have like it better if it was green instead of white.
customer_reviews.author: Sherrie

customer_reviews.title: Necessary item for winter
customer_reviews.text: Shipping was fast. I haven't used it yet, but looks like it is exactly what I wanted, and will do the job.
customer_reviews.author: lmcshop

customer_reviews.title: Very well made with a zipper and drawstring
customer_reviews.text: I like the size and shape. It is thick without being too thick for the plants to breathe. Great coverage for my very large ferns and several other extra large pots. I like how easy it was to cover my plants, zip it up and pull the drawstring around it all. Really like this cover. Very neat. I'll get more potted plants for my porch and order another cover for the winter now that I have a great winter cover for them.
customer_reviews.author: Gladys Jules

customer_reviews.title: Perfect product for protecting plants from frost.
customer_reviews.text: I covered bougainvillea for frost protection. The sheets are large enough to fully cover the plants. Material is tough enough to not tear when snagged on thorns and light enough to work around large plants. I used glue gun to make some 16' wise pieces. Seems to hold up in the wind.
customer_reviews.author: William J. Slosarik

customer_reviews.title: Plant frost protection cover
customer_reviews.text: Bought 5 total. Great product, I'm very pleased with durability.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous5

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: Save your money this doesnt work at all all my plants died expect the one that was too far away to reach to cover with this so I used plastic
customer_reviews.author: udontkno

customer_reviews.title: 5 star
customer_reviews.text: So far so good all the plants are still alive we've had many nights of freezing, in fact the weeds are really loving it under there
customer_reviews.author: Rantti Hediscus

customer_reviews.title: My plants are warm and well!
customer_reviews.text: These have saved my plants during several freezes this winter. So much easier than the bedsheets I used to use! Very effective.
customer_reviews.author: Cheche

customer_reviews.title: Light weight protection
customer_reviews.text: This product is protecting a Bracken Brown Magnolia tree replacement. It is light weight and not heavy that it damages the tree.
customer_reviews.author: S. McKee

customer_reviews.title: Durability not good
customer_reviews.text: Product was not very durable. Would not hold up during high winds.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Reynols

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: So far it is protecting some new plantings. We've had some overnight frosts. I am planning on this working through the colder winter weather.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie S

customer_reviews.title: Just what we needed
customer_reviews.text: Perfect to cover and protect our 2 large spago palms !!!
customer_reviews.author: John K.

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 of these plant covers for here in Phoenix, AZ. I used them on a recent "cold snap". My plants got frostbit anyhow. VERY disappointed!!
customer_reviews.author: Missy

customer_reviews.title: work great!
customer_reviews.text: we covered all our plants in Scottsdale when we had a rare freeze. they work great! the covers are light weight, so we had to get creative to keep them down with the high winds
customer_reviews.author: Raleigh C Kiser

customer_reviews.title: This stuff works!
customer_reviews.text: This material has withstood a Virginia winter, (so far) the plants we covered with it are doing fine!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: almost transparent, will have to wait for colder weather to test results of use
customer_reviews.text: light weight, easy to use, easy to fold back up and store. time will tell if it is satisfactory.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I really like how easily I could tie this cover down and how durable it was through a storm. That is the main use I had for this cover. The only thing I found was the material will inevitably have holes made in it by pine cones. Still, the cover is pretty durable.
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. A waste of money. Covered my plants to extend the season. The first time used, my posts went right through the fabric. Very flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: Bea

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I used these with clothes pins to frost protect my semi-dwarf citrus trees from frost.
customer_reviews.author: Marcia A.

customer_reviews.title: Plant blanket
customer_reviews.text: Protects some of my plants. They are warm from wind yet still get sunshine.
customer_reviews.author: #1consumer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful for Citrus Trees!
customer_reviews.text: I love these plant covers. I use them to keep my citrus trees warm during the winter. They are very effective!
customer_reviews.author: bj_hawks

customer_reviews.title: Tears easily
customer_reviews.text: This product tears easily . It also needs to come in better widths. I tore it just trying to stretch it over my plants.
customer_reviews.author: carolitself

customer_reviews.title: Cheap. Flimsy. Worthless.
customer_reviews.text: Cheap. Cheap. Cheap. The sheet was already torn in several places. I cut around it. I wrapped this around a PVC hoop house I built and we got 1 night of heavy rain and it tore in several places. I’ve had it up for 2 days. I wouldn’t use this protect anything. Might as well use toilet paper. Waste of money. Going to have to buy plastic now.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley A. Hoke

customer_reviews.title: gets the job done for me
customer_reviews.text: I am not a serious farmer -- just flowers -- keeps the frost off.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S Sweeney

customer_reviews.title: Plants stayed happy
customer_reviews.text: It was really nice during the nights we had surprise low temps. Kept the plants nice and warm.
customer_reviews.author: Kristine

customer_reviews.title: Love the product.
customer_reviews.text: I love that it covers all my plants that I have on my pole with out damaging them.The delivery was very fast, in fact, it only took one day.
customer_reviews.author: coco lopez

customer_reviews.title: Ready for the freezing temperatures
customer_reviews.text: I’m looking forward to using this the next freeze we have.
customer_reviews.author: Martha

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: We ordered more of these they are great freeze protection
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love this. will be ordering this product again in the very near future, thank you !!
customer_reviews.author: Debs

customer_reviews.title: Hope it works
customer_reviews.text: I can’t wait to use them when the frost comes
customer_reviews.author: SKnowles(firelady)

customer_reviews.title: Super frost cloths!
customer_reviews.text: These freeze cloths were excellent. They're keeping all of my plants from the frost! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Gayle S.

customer_reviews.title: Plant cover
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Just had a frost. Kept my plants from freezing
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine Russo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect material
customer_reviews.text: Good material for saving the plants from freezing during winters... I recommend it...
customer_reviews.author: NG

customer_reviews.title: Durable and easy to customize to your garden
customer_reviews.text: As advertised. Durable and easy to customize to your garden. Allows water to penetrate to bed if covering whole bed.
customer_reviews.author: David S.

customer_reviews.title: frost protect blankets
customer_reviews.text: - These frost protect blankets appeared to be much thinner than the ones I bought previously, but they appear to be doing their job. - I will know in the spring if it protected my plants. Hopefully I will be able to reuse these for the next couple of years, if taken care of. - I was able to reuse the previously purchased blankets for 3 seasons before having to replace them. I purchased the same blankets again, knowing they should be good for at least 2-3 seasons.
customer_reviews.author: S. Shoji

customer_reviews.title: Stronger then you may expect
customer_reviews.text: Came on time, the product is as described. Solid quality, strong and looking durable.
customer_reviews.author: tomp

customer_reviews.title: Size
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product recommend to everyone that comes into my plant nursery
customer_reviews.author: richard hougrand

customer_reviews.title: Frost coverings
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t used it. Probably be next year. Most of our frost should be over. I believe it will work.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne G.

customer_reviews.title: My plants survived the freeze
customer_reviews.text: I could cut the product to size to cover 4 different garden areas. Saved my plants from freezing temps!
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia M. Cole

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: I like the feel and weight of this product. Will see how my plants fare over the winter.
customer_reviews.author: WMH

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Delivery time was better than expected. Covers helped me save many fruit trees in the yard this year.
customer_reviews.author: DonPolfini

customer_reviews.title: It  does  nothing  at  30 degrees for two days, in a word,  ineffective !
customer_reviews.text: DID NOT WORK AS OTHER BRANDS HAD WORKED ON THE SAME COLD DAY,, GROUND COVER BURNT UP BLACK TEMPS 30 DEGREES CENTRAL FLORIDA FOR TWO DAYS..
customer_reviews.author: Michael S.

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price. As others have noted it does not allow any water in, but if you cover it tightly the roots still get water from the dirt around it.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen D.

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fabric is not strong enough. It ripped immediately on one of my tomato cages.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Fish

customer_reviews.title: Not a true value
customer_reviews.text: Pictured as complete with the frame got just a piece of cloth lost my sensitive plants
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, easy to resize with shears, and it works, frost after frost. I am really enjoying it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Coverage
customer_reviews.text: I was very pleased with this product. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Freida Rains

customer_reviews.title: Great product! I used it to cover my flowers ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product! I used it to cover my flowers protecting them from the late freeze/frost. It was large enough to make two ground covers out of it. It is breathable so that it can stay on and still get sunlight through it.
customer_reviews.author: KGM
